Articles.Content: I have quite a few mods. I also have ActiveTextureManagement to keep RAM crashes at bay. The problem is that having very low resolution textures bothers me. I hate being able to see the pixels on the textures; it just doesn't feel natural. Is there any mod that can save me enough RAM to not have crashes?
If you are running windows there something like open GL.

Try DDSloader maybe? You can use the DDS converter tool: [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/98672-WIN-KSP-to-DDS-texture-converter](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/98672-WIN-KSP-to-DDS-texture-converter) to convert the stuff to DDS. I use both that and ATM and the performance is definetly better.

Using DDS will even fix the low res textures.

DDS saves you load time, not memory. Though it's strongly recommended. 

Forced OpenGL mode is what should allow you to use plenty of mods staying under 3Gb memory usage.

The DDS converter can do the same job as ATM & resize images though ( or your own converter/paint package can ). OpenGL or DX11 modes offload textures to VRAM & Texture Replacer will unload textures from memory so you save a GB or so. OpenGL seems to free a little more memory than DX11 but has worse issues for me. REMOVE ATM if you do this - all it does for me is use 400MB of memory for no reason.

Ven's stock revamp will save a bit if you remove the original Squad parts it replaces.

Hello, you can try the mod [Loading textures only as required](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/73236) but it's in WIP and there's only an unofficial update of the dll for 0.90 which you can find here: [https://github.com/jamesb6626/KspLoadOnDemand/releases](https://github.com/jamesb6626/KspLoadOnDemand/releases)
